page.title: 11Scouting and Guiding
page.content: Each patrol has a patrol leader and a seconder. All the patrols have names, our names at our pack are of birds. They are chaffinch, nightingales, king fishes and swallows. You and your patrol have to work together and help each other. Every year we go to camp and you have to fend for your self. There are activities too at camp so it isnt just work! A young guide is called a brownie, an older guide is called a Ranger guide. The opposite of a guide is a scout. At guides your promise is: "I promise that I will do my best to do my duty to god, to serve the queen and to help other people and to keep the guide law." At guides you can earn badges, like hostess, cooking, fitness etc. You have to do a test and if you pass you get a badge. Quite often at guides we have a camp fire and sing songs.
